page.title: 04The affects of the river
page.content: The River Thames is the northern border of the area.Its flood plain has produced very fertile soil which is efficiently farmed.The main villages lie on the high ground to the south. The river is used by anglers and holiday makers on boats.Pike,perch,chub barble and bream are found here. Newbridge is one of the oldest bridges over the Thames.It was rebuilt in 1462 from Cotswold Stone.The middle stone locks the arch together.There is an inn on each side of the bridge which also was the site of a battle in the Civil War. Appleton Bridge is a footbridge further downstream.It is made from wood on cement piers.It is very steep and moves up and down if you jump on it.Its purpose was to join the lock-keeper's house to the other bank.Only a few bricks remain of the house and lock.
